title: Nine Killed in South Dakota Plane Crash
summary: 12 were aboard Pilatus PC-12, according to NTSB; weather to be among several factors under review. CHAMBERLAIN, S.D.-Authorities say nine people have been killed after a plane crashed in South Dakota.

title: Marquee Brands Bids $50 Million for Destination Maternity
summary: Neuberger Berman-backed firm agrees to acquire retailer's brand name, e-commerce business, subject to a higher bid at bankruptcy auction. Bankrupt retailer Destination Maternity Corp. will shut down its remaining 235 retail stores under a deal that would see a licensing firm buy the company's brand name and other assets for $50 million.

title: Merkel's Government Faces New Blow
summary: The new designated leaders in her coalition's junior partner have warned they would leave the coalition without a sharp swing to the left. BERLIN-The fate of Angela Merkel's government was in question Saturday after the junior partner in her coalition picked leaders who have pledged to end the alliance unless they get policy concessions from her conservatives.

title: Homeless Man Arrested in Netherlands Stabbings
summary: Resume Subscription. THE HAGUE-Dutch police arrested a homeless man on Saturday over a knife assault in a busy shopping street in which three teenagers were wounded.

title: Attack by Convicted Terrorist Prompts U.K. to Review Sentencing
summary: Usman Khan who killed two people in London was released from jail in 2018 under a set of conditions. LONDON-The British government will review its sentencing policies after a convicted terrorist on early release from prison carried out a stabbing attack in the heart of London that left two people dead.

title: After Touting Access, Hudson Yards Welcomes a Private Club
summary: Resume Subscription. In its short history, Hudson Yards has touted itself as a restaurant destination available to all, with options ranging from fast-casual to fine dining.

title: Found: Women's Jeans That Won't Go Out of Style
summary: Each season, denim cuts morph anew, rendering your wardrobe woefully out of date. Thankfully, a new crop of brands is embracing timelessness. AT CURRENT count, there are 18 pairs of jeans in my closet, not including whatever lurks in the storage bins under my bed. Of that bloated group, only three are in regular rotation. The rest-too skinny, too stretch, too cropped and gently flared, too "mom jeans"-have been rendered dated by the new and cool, and shelved or downgraded to something that I will only wear to the airport.

title: U.K. Knife Attacker Who Killed Two Was a Convicted Terrorist
summary: Police identified the suspect as 28-year-old Usman Khan who had been convicted in 2012 for terrorism offenses. LONDON-A convicted terrorist released from prison last year killed two people in a stabbing attack in the heart of London before being shot dead by police Friday, prompting authorities to lock down a busy area on the edge of the financial district and bringing back memories of a 2017 rampage nearby.

title: 'Mrs. Maisel' Co-Star Alex Borstein on What It Means to Be Ambitious
summary: "I think fear is important when you're young and hungry". The third season of "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" is set to premiere this Friday, but Alex Borstein, who co-stars as the tough but passionate talent manager Susie Myerson and who won two Emmys for the role, doesn't actually watch the show.

title: Farmers Rushed Into Hemp. Now They Face a Glut.
summary: Prices for the crops are falling, and some growers are struggling to unload their product. CYNTHIANA, Ky.-Tony Ockerman, a fourth-generation farmer hoping to diversify his crops by adding hemp, said his first harvest this year turned out well after plenty of trial and error. But he is struggling in one key respect: finding buyers.

title: For Boomers and Their Children, Money Conversations Can Be Tough
summary: Talking to family about money can be hard, even without generational strife. The holiday season is a time for family gatherings, traditions and, predictably, some drama-filled conversations. The latter can involve some of the most difficult subjects for families: money, personal finance and what counts as success.

title: Ordered by Singapore, Facebook Posts a Correction
summary: Adds notice to post saying it 'is legally required to tell you that the Singapore government says this post has false information'. SINGAPORE- Facebook Inc. added a "correction notice" to a post that Singapore authorities alleged contains false information, becoming the first technology company to comply with a new law the government says is meant to curb fake news.

title: Inside Trump Administration's Debate on Ukraine Aid Delay
summary: After the president gave the order, which is central to the impeachment inquiry, officials puzzled over the rationale and legality of the move.

title: 'Making Marvels: Science & Splendor at the Courts of Europe' Review: If You've Got It, Flaunt It
summary: The glittering, sensational objects in this show-many never before seen in the U.S.-were created for the wealthy and the powerful with a singular goal in mind: to impress..

title: Global Child-Porn Sting Puts Pressure on South Korea
summary: Enforcement challenges surface as a website's Korean operator gets a far shorter sentence than clients in the West. SEOUL-An international operation to take down what was the world's largest child-pornography website resulted in heavy prison sentences around the world-but not in South Korea, where much of the material was uploaded and viewed.

summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: De Beers Diamonds Reflect a Changing Market
summary: Mining giant embraces traceability and synthetic stones as natural diamond deposits shrink. ORAPA, Botswana-De Beers is facing up to a tough reality: The world's diamond deposits won't last forever.

title: Bloomberg's Entry Assumes He Can Upend Conventional Wisdom
summary: While other candidates embrace early traditions, the billionaire big spender aims to have a super Tuesday in March. In a generally quiet holiday week on the presidential campaign trail, that rumbling you could hear in the distance was created by Michael Bloomberg.

title: Elon Musk and the Dying Art of the Big Bet
summary: In the age of Big Data, Tesla's stated approach to market research-ignoring it altogether-seems especially reckless. The show began Nov. 21 in Los Angeles with smoke, lasers and leaping plumes of fire. Then a futuristic new electric truck rolled onstage; a fever dream of sharp angles, flat steel panels and supervillain aesthetics.

title: Bloomberg Joins Eclectic List of Self-Funded Presidential Candidates
summary: Some won, some lost, some are still fighting for attention in the Democratic primary. Billionaire Michael Bloomberg's recent decision to enter the Democratic presidential primary highlights America's rich and nonpartisan history of wealthy men trying to self-finance their way to the White House.
